name: economy
trans: n. 经济；节约；理财 n. (Economy)人名；(英)伊科诺米

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: gravel
trans: n. 碎石；砂砾 vt. 用碎石铺；使船搁浅在沙滩上；使困惑 n. (Gravel)人名；(英、法、西)格拉韦尔

sentences.english: a gravel path
sentences.chinese: 石子小道

detailed_translations.english: small stones, used to make a surface for paths, roads etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 用碎石铺；使船搁浅在沙滩上；使困惑

name: greed
trans: n. 贪婪，贪心

sentences.english: people motivated by jealousy and greed
sentences.chinese: 受妒忌和贪婪驱使的人们

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: rumor
trans: n. 谣言；传闻 vt. 谣传；传说 n. (Rumor)人名；(意、葡)鲁莫尔

sentences.english: The rumor rocked the whole city.
sentences.chinese: 谣言使整个城市惊慌不安。

sentences.english: In fact the rumor is without foundation.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这个谣传没有根据。

name: settler
trans: n. 移居者；殖民者 n. (Settler)人名；(德)泽特勒

sentences.english: early settlers in Australia
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的早期移民

detailed_translations.english: someone who goes to live in a country or area where not many people like them have lived before, and that is a long way from any towns or cities

name: starvation
trans: n. 饿死；挨饿；绝食

sentences.english: people dying of starvation
sentences.chinese: 快饿死的人们

detailed_translations.english: suffering or death caused by lack of food

name: disguise
trans: vt. 掩饰；假装；隐瞒 n. 伪装；假装；用作伪装的东西

sentences.english: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation.
sentences.chinese: 他无意掩饰他的不安。

sentences.english: He is a master of disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是伪装高手。

detailed_translations.english: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

name: enslave
trans: vt. 束缚；征服；使某人成为奴隶

sentences.english: She seemed enslaved by hatred.
sentences.chinese: 她似乎被仇恨所左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 束缚；征服；使某人成为奴隶
detailed_translations.english: to make someone a slave

name: escapee
trans: n. 逃避者；逃亡者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has escaped from somewhere

name: segregated
trans: adj. 被隔离的 v. 隔离（segregate的过去式）；分离

name: servant
trans: n. 仆人，佣人；公务员；雇工 n. (Servant)人名；(西)塞尔万特；(法)塞尔旺

sentences.english: Many young girls became domestic servants .
sentences.chinese: 许多年轻姑娘成了家仆。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially in the past, who was paid to clean someone’s house, cook for them, answer the door etc, and who often lived in the house

name: indigenous
trans: adj. 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: risk
trans: n. 风险；危险；冒险 vt. 冒…的危险 n. (Risk)人名；(英、阿拉伯)里斯克

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: unique
trans: adj. 独特的，稀罕的；[数] 唯一的，独一无二的 n. 独一无二的人或物 n. (Unique)人名；(英)尤妮克

sentences.english: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
sentences.chinese: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

detailed_translations.english: being the only one of its kind

name: vast
trans: adj. 广阔的；巨大的；大量的；巨额的 n. 浩瀚；广阔无垠的空间 n. (Vast)人名；(法)瓦斯特

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: wealth
trans: n. 财富；大量；富有

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

name: city-state
trans: n. 城邦

name: control
trans: n. 控制；管理；抑制；操纵装置 vt. 控制；管理；抑制

sentences.english: Police had to be called in to control the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 只好调来警察控制人群。

sentences.english: He controlled the urge to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他克制住笑的冲动。

sentences.english: The disease robs you of muscle control.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会让你丧失肌肉控制力。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something do what you want, or make something happen in the way that you want
the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want or make something happen in the way you want

name: dominate
trans: vt. 控制；支配；占优势；在…中占主要地位 vi. 占优势；处于支配地位

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: empire
trans: n. 帝国；帝王统治，君权 n. (Empire)人名；(法)昂皮尔

sentences.english: the Roman empire
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国

detailed_translations.english: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

name: intelligence
trans: n. 智力；情报工作；情报机关；理解力；才智，智慧；天分

sentences.english: To be good at the game, you need a reasonable level of intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 要想把这种游戏玩好，需要一定的智力水平。

sentences.english: According to our intelligence, further attacks were planned.
sentences.chinese: 根据我们的情报，还会有更进一步的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: cacao
trans: n. 可可；可可豆；[植] 可可树

name: fermentation
trans: n. 发酵

sentences.english: But thrumming underneath it is a deep layer of culinary funkreminiscent of fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 但敲打底部是深一层的使人想起的厨房的恐怖的发酵。

sentences.english: At that time, any fish caught had to be preserved. The only method possible was by fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在那个年代，所有捕来的鱼都要被贮存起来，唯一可能的贮存方法就是发酵。

sentences.english: They baited others with CO2 produced by fermentation when yeast is mixed with a sugar solution.
sentences.chinese: 他们用酵母与糖溶液混合后发酵产生的CO2作为另一些陷阱的饵。

name: ingredient
trans: n. 原料；要素；组成部分 adj. 构成组成部分的

sentences.english: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把所有食材都放在一个大碗里。

sentences.english: The food is home-cooked using fresh ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 这种食物是用新鲜的食材在家里烹制的。

detailed_translations.english: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

name: mill
trans: n. 磨坊，磨粉厂；工厂，制造厂；磨粉机；碾磨机；机器，铣床；（非正式）引擎；（非正式，旧）拳击比赛；密尔（北美货币单位，等于0.001美元）；（口语）一百万 v. 碾磨，磨细；切割（金属），铣；轧出（硬币的）边纹；（人或动物）乱转；（使羊毛等）缩绒 n. (Mill) 米尔（人名）

sentences.english: All our flours are milled using traditional methods.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的面粉全是用传统方法碾磨的。

sentences.english: Add some freshly milled black pepper.
sentences.chinese: 加一些现磨的黑胡椒粉。

detailed_translations.english: to crush grain, pepper etc in a mill

detailed_translations.chinese: 磨坊；碾磨机；制造厂，工厂
detailed_translations.english: a building containing a large machine for crushing grain into flour

name: solidify
trans: vt. 团结；凝固 vi. 团结；凝固

sentences.english: The volcanic lava solidifies as it cools.
sentences.chinese: 火山熔岩冷却后变成固体。

sentences.english: solidified cream
sentences.chinese: 凝固的奶油

detailed_translations.english: to become solid or make something solid

name: bridle
trans: n. 缰绳；马勒；系带；约束物 vt. 控制；给装马勒 vi. 昂首表示轻蔑；生气 n. (Bridle)人名；(英)布赖德尔

sentences.english: The metal mouthpiece of a bridle, serving to control, curb, and direct an animal.
sentences.chinese: 马勒， 嚼子放在嘴里的金属制马勒，用于控制约束和驾御牲畜。

sentences.english: Inadvertently the paper added a comma to the ad, which read instead:Horse, saddle and bridle for $50.
sentences.chinese: 无意中报纸在广告语中加了个逗号，读起来成这样了，50元卖马，马鞍和马缰绳。

sentences.english: These included a saddle, bridle, clay vase, wooden bowl, trough, iron kettle, the remains of an entire horse, and ancient clothing.
sentences.chinese: 这些物品包括一个鞍，缰绳，黏土花瓶，木碗，饲料槽，铁壶，一整匹马的遗骸以及一件古老的衣服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 上笼头； 昂首 ； 抑制
detailed_translations.english: to put a bridle on a horse
a set of leather bands put around a horse’s head and used to control its movements

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；工具；乐器；手段；器械 v. 给……装测量仪器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.chinese: 仪器， 工具； 乐器
detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: inventor
trans: n. 发明家；[专利] 发明人；创造者

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔，电话的发明者

detailed_translations.english: someone who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字 n. (Legend)人名；(西)莱亨德；(英)莱金德

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: shock
trans: n. 休克；震惊；震动；打击；禾束堆 vt. 使休克；使震惊；使震动；使受电击；把…堆成禾束堆 vi. 感到震惊；受到震动；堆成禾束堆 adj. 浓密的；蓬乱的 n. (Shock)人名；(英)肖克

sentences.english: The hatred in her voice shocked him.
sentences.chinese: 她语气中的仇恨让他震惊。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very surprised and upset, and unable to believe what has happened

name: temperature
trans: n. 温度；体温；气温；发烧

sentences.english: The temperature of the water was just right for swimming.
sentences.chinese: 这水温游泳正好。

sentences.english: Water boils at a temperature of 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 水在100摄氏度沸腾。

sentences.english: The nurse took (= measured ) my temperature .
sentences.chinese: 护士给我量了体温。

detailed_translations.english: a measure of how hot or cold a place or thing is

name: endangered
trans: adj. 濒临灭绝的；有生命危险的

sentences.english: I think there are many endangered animals in the world, such as tigers and pandas.
sentences.chinese: 我认为有许多濒临灭绝的动物，如老虎和大熊猫，在世界。

sentences.english: I think our government should punish those people severely who kill the rare animals. It is our duty to protect the endangered animals.
sentences.chinese: 我认为政府应该严厉惩罚那些捕杀稀有动物的人。保护濒临灭绝的动物是我们的责任。

sentences.english: However, it holds six language families, two of which have only one remaining language, and almost all of the languages here are endangered.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它拥有六个语族，其中两个语族仅剩下一种语言，而且这儿几乎所有的语言都濒临灭绝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 濒危的， 将要灭绝的

name: habitat
trans: n. [生态] 栖息地，产地 n. (Habitat)人名；(德)哈比塔特

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: population
trans: n. 人口；[生物] 种群，[生物] 群体；全体居民；[统计学] 总体

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: remote
trans: adj. 遥远的；偏僻的；疏远的 n. 远程

sentences.english: a remote border town
sentences.chinese: 一个偏远的边境小镇

sentences.english: a fire in a remote mountain area
sentences.chinese: 偏远山区的火灾

detailed_translations.chinese: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
detailed_translations.english: far from towns or other places where people live

name: scientist
trans: n. 科学家

sentences.english: He is a scientist of high prestige.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位有声望的科学家。

sentences.english: As a scientist,he disbelieves in Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名科学家，他不信耶稣。

sentences.english: The scientist thirsts after an achievement.
sentences.chinese: 这名科学家渴望取得成就。

detailed_translations.english: someone who works or is trained in science

name: species
trans: n. [生物] 物种；种类 adj. 物种上的

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: calorie
trans: n. 卡路里（热量单位）

sentences.english: A potato has about 90 calories.
sentences.chinese: 一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.english: a calorie-controlled diet
sentences.chinese: 控制热量的日常饮食

sentences.english: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.chinese: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.english: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

name: carbohydrates
trans: n. [有化] 糖类（carbohydrate的复数）；[有化] 碳水化物

name: fat
trans: adj. 肥的，胖的；油腻的；丰满的 n. 脂肪，肥肉 vt. 养肥；在…中加入脂肪 vi. 长肥 n. (Fat)人名；(法、西、塞)法特；(东南亚国家华语)发

sentences.english: Are you suggesting I’m too fat?
sentences.chinese: 你是不是在说我太胖了？

sentences.english: a short fat man in his early fifties
sentences.chinese: 一个五十岁出头的矮胖男人

sentences.english: You’ll get fat if you eat all that chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把那些巧克力都吃了，就会变胖的。

sentences.english: He looks much fatter than in his photo.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去比相片上胖多了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 肥的，胖的；油腻的；丰满的
detailed_translations.english: weighing too much because you have too much flesh on your body
a substance that is stored under the skin of people and animals, that helps to keep them warm

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物；滋养物 adj. 营养的；滋养的

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: nutrition
trans: n. 营养，营养学；营养品

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: protein
trans: n. 蛋白质；朊 adj. 蛋白质的

sentences.english: Where do you get your protein?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪里获得蛋白质？

sentences.english: Dairy source of protein and calcium.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的蛋白质来源和钙。

sentences.english: So, what happens, this is another view of a sodium channel, so this is actually looking a little bit more at the protein structure .
sentences.chinese: 那么，这里发生了什么，这是钠离子通道的另一张图片，在这种蛋白质结构中，它看起来更复杂一点。

detailed_translations.english: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: innocence
trans: n. 清白，无罪；天真无邪

sentences.english: Can you prove your innocence?
sentences.chinese: 你能证明自己清白吗？

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being not guilty of a crime

name: prank
trans: n. 恶作剧，开玩笑；戏谑 vt. 装饰；打扮 vi. 炫耀自己；胡闹

sentences.english: a childish prank
sentences.chinese: 孩子气的恶作剧

detailed_translations.english: a trick, especially one which is played on someone to make them look silly
to dress or decorate showily or gaudily

name: protest
trans: n. 抗议，反对；（多来自公证人）拒付证书 v. 抗议，反对；坚决表示，断言；拒付

sentences.english: ‘I don’t see why I should take the blame for this!’ she protested.

sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: harbor
trans: n. 港，海港；避难所 v. 庇护；窝藏；怀有；为……提供庇护；入港停泊；居住，生存 n. (Harbor) （美）哈伯（人名）

sentences.english: All the battleships can refresh in this harbor.
sentences.chinese: 所有战舰都能在这个港口装上补充供应品。

sentences.english: It is the harbor of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 它是雅典的港口城。

sentences.english: She stands on a small island in New York harbor, near the great city.
sentences.chinese: 她竖立在纽约海港的一座小岛，并紧挨着纽约这座大城市。

name: inflatable
trans: adj. 膨胀的，可充气的；得意的

name: kayak
trans: n. 皮船；爱斯基摩小艇

name: mammal
trans: n. [脊椎] 哺乳动物

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: adaptable
trans: adj. 适合的；能适应的；可修改的

sentences.english: The American Constitution has proved adaptable in changing political conditions.
sentences.chinese: 事实证明美国宪法能适应政治形势的变化。

detailed_translations.english: able to change in order to be successful in new and different situations

name: data
trans: n. 数据（datum的复数）；资料 n. (Data)人名；(日)驮太 (姓)；(印、葡)达塔

sentences.english: The research involves collecting data from two random samples.
sentences.chinese: 该项研究需要从两个随机样本里收集资料。

detailed_translations.english: information or facts
information or facts

name: expedition
trans: n. 远征；探险队；迅速

sentences.english: an expedition to the North Pole
sentences.chinese: 北极探险

sentences.english: another Qomolangma expedition
sentences.chinese: 又一次珠穆朗玛峰探险

detailed_translations.english: a long and carefully organized journey, especially to a dangerous or unfamiliar place, or the people that make this journey

name: marine
trans: adj. 船舶的；海生的；海产的；航海的，海运的 n. 海运业；舰队；水兵；（海军）士兵或军官 n. (Marine)人名；(西)马里内；(英)马林

sentences.english: the enormous variety of marine life
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物繁多的种类

sentences.english: the effects of oil pollution on marine mammals
sentences.chinese: 石油污染对海洋哺乳动物的影响

sentences.english: marine biology
sentences.chinese: 海洋生物学

trans: adj. 能潜水的；能沉入水中的

sentences.english: an electric blanket
sentences.chinese: 电热毯

detailed_translations.english: needing electricity to work, produced by electricity, or used for carrying electricity

name: stun

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷

name: volt

sentences.english: That is one electron volt.
sentences.chinese: 就是一单位的电子伏特。

sentences.english: If I multiply these two, what is the coulomb times a volt?
sentences.chinese: 如果我把这两个乘起来，库仑乘以伏特是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring the force of an electric current

sentences.english: Upon marriage, a woman automatically lost most of her legal rights and became an appendage of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 结婚后，妇女自动失去自己大部分的法律权利，成为丈夫的附属品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 附加物；下属；[动][解剖] 附器（如植物的枝叶和动物的腿尾）
detailed_translations.english: something that is connected to a larger or more important thing

name: herbivore
trans: n. [动] 食草动物

sentences.english: The meat of the herbivore is, in comparison, far more edible , smellwise.
sentences.chinese: 相对地，食草动物的肉闻起来要好些，更易食用。

sentences.english: I only eat vegetables (scientists call me a herbivore) -- almost always leaves from the tops of trees.
sentences.chinese: 我只吃蔬菜(科学家称我为草食动物)—几乎常常是树梢的叶子。

sentences.english: You probably would call me a vegetarian. But scientists call me a herbivore because I only eat leaves, grass and other plants.
sentences.chinese: 可能你会说我是素食者，但科学家称我为草食动物，因为我只吃叶子、草和其它植物。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that only eats plants

name: immense
trans: adj. 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: ivory
trans: n. 象牙；乳白色；长牙 adj. 乳白色的；象牙制的 n. (Ivory)人名；(英)艾沃里

sentences.english: an ivory chess set
sentences.chinese: 一副象牙国际象棋

sentences.english: an ivory silk wedding gown
sentences.chinese: 乳白色真丝婚纱

detailed_translations.english: the hard smooth yellowish-white substance from the tusks of an  elephant

name: nurse
trans: n. 护士；保姆；奶妈；防护树；保育虫；沙锥齿鲨 v. 照料，护理；当护士；调养；喂奶；吃奶；怀有；精心照料；喝；抱住；聚球 n. (Nurse) （美、爱）纳斯（人名）

sentences.english: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士会来给你打针。

sentences.english: The school nurse sent Sara home.
sentences.chinese: 学校的护士送萨拉回家。

sentences.english: a male nurse
sentences.chinese: 男护士

sentences.english: a senior nurse
sentences.chinese: 高级护士

sentences.english: a student nurse (= someone who is learning to be a nurse )
sentences.chinese: 实习护士

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse (= a nurse for people who are mentally ill )
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: He’s been nursing an elderly relative.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在照顾一位年老的亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
to look after someone who is ill or injured

trans: n. 獠牙（tusk的复数）；[建] 墙面牙石 v. 用长牙掘（tusk的第三人称单数）

trans: n. 文明；文化

sentences.chinese: 现代美国文明

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Greece and Rome
sentences.chinese: 希腊和罗马的古代文明

detailed_translations.english: a society that is well organized and developed, used especially about a particular society in a particular place or at a particular time

name: climate
trans: n. 气候；风气；思潮；风土

sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

name: evaporate
trans: vt. 使……蒸发；使……脱水；使……消失 vi. 蒸发，挥发；消失，失踪

sentences.english: Most of the water had evaporated.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的水都蒸发了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporates moisture on the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 太阳会蒸发叶子上的水分。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas
if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

name: latitude
trans: n. 纬度；界限；活动范围

sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

sentences.chinese: 我们沿着运河边往前走。

sentences.english: the Panama Canal
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河

detailed_translations.chinese: 运河；[地理] 水道；[建] 管道；灌溉水渠
detailed_translations.english: a long passage dug into the ground and filled with water, either for boats to travel along, or to take water to a place

name: hemisphere

sentences.english: the Northern hemisphere
sentences.chinese: 北半球

detailed_translations.english: a half of the Earth, especially one of the halves above and below the equator

name: inlet
trans: n. 入口，进口；插入物；水湾 v. 引进; 嵌入; 插入;

sentences.english: There are several sheltered inlets along the coast.
sentences.chinese: 沿着海岸线有几处有天然屏障的水湾。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow area of water that reaches from the sea or a lake into the land

detailed_translations.chinese: 引进; 嵌入; 插入;

trans: n. 至，至日；至点

trans: n. 赤道

sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

name: mosque
trans: n. 清真寺

sentences.english: Would you go to church or the synagogue or the mosque?
sentences.chinese: 你会去教堂，犹太教会，或者清真寺吗？

sentences.english: If there is to be a new city church, they argue, then why not a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 他们置疑说，如果要修建一个新的城市教堂为什么不能是座清真寺呢？

sentences.english: Tell the congregation of a church or mosque that existence is too vulgar an attribute to fasten onto their God, and they will brand you an atheist.
sentences.chinese: 告诉教堂或清真寺的会众们，存在，是强加在他们的上帝身上的一种过于庸俗的属性，他们将会指责你为无神论者。

detailed_translations.english: a building in which Muslims worship

name: rainforest
trans: n. （热带）雨林

sentences.english: The rainforest is essential in other areas also.
sentences.chinese: 雨林在其他地区也是必不可少的。

sentences.english: The rainforest around our house sometimes brings forth intriguing creatures like this.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房子周围的雨林有时带来了这样有趣的生物。

sentences.english: Then we carried on in the worst conditions yet: low, tangled rainforest that blocked out the light, and mud up to our thighs.
sentences.chinese: 那时我们还在最糟糕的环境里行进着：低矮、纷乱的雨林遮住了阳光，泥浆没至我们的大腿。

name: stilt
trans: n. 高跷；支柱，支撑物 vt. 使踏上高跷

sentences.english: When holidays came, there were Yangko and stilt shows with people eager to participate.
sentences.chinese: 过节时会有扭秧歌、踩高跷表演，人们也都乐意参加。

sentences.english: The most noteworthy features of mangrove forests, apart from their unique habitat, are: the relative paucity of the species comprising them; the arch-formed stilt roots of the Rhizophora spp.;
sentences.chinese: 除了其独特的生境以外， 红树林最令人注意的特征是构成红树林的品种比较单一； Rhizophora 品种的拱形高跷根系；其它属的悬空根系团或呼吸根，如 Avicennia 和 Sonneratia。

detailed_translations.english: one of two poles which you can stand on and walk high above the ground

name: terrace
trans: n. 平台；梯田；阳台 vt. 使成梯田，使成阶地；使有平台屋顶 vi. 成阶地；成梯田；筑成坛 adj. （女服）叠层式的 n. (Terrace)人名；(英)特勒斯

sentences.english: Both a staircase and a lift connect the two floors with an enclosed terrace on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 通过一道楼梯和一台电梯连接两层楼和封闭的屋顶平台。

sentences.english: Mirrored walls, skylights and large plated windows overlooking the garden and terrace fill this modern space with light.
sentences.chinese: 镜墙、天窗和大型的金属镀窗俯瞰花园和阳台，让这个现代空间充满光线。

detailed_translations.english: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: elevation
trans: n. 高地；海拔；提高；崇高；正面图

sentences.english: The city is at an elevation of 2 000 metres.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市海拔2000米。

detailed_translations.english: the height of a place, especially its height above sea level

name: precipitation
trans: n. [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
detailed_translations.english: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls

name: adapt
trans: vt. 使适应；改编 vi. 适应

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: gravity
trans: n. 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严

sentences.english: the force of gravity
sentences.chinese: 重力

sentences.english: I could not hide from her the gravity of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 我不能向她隐瞒情况的严重性。

detailed_translations.english: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

name: invertebrate
trans: adj. 无脊椎的；无骨气的 n. 无脊椎动物；无骨气的人

sentences.english: Concept artist Terryl Whitlatch wanted the colo claw fish to have an invertebrate look, so her early designs were based on an earwig.
sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.english: There was a hierarchical system in neurobiology, and working in invertebrate animals was not looked upon favorably, except in a very special case: the squid giant axon.
sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.english: Smithers, don't you think it's ironic that your irregular night-time activities are in inverse proportion to your reputation as an expert in the area of invertebrate research?
sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that does not have a  backbone

name: predator
trans: n. [动] 捕食者；[动] 食肉动物；掠夺者

sentences.english: With no natural predators on the island, the herd increased rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 由于岛上没有天然食肉动物，牧群的数量迅速增加。

detailed_translations.english: an animal that kills and eats other animals

name: substrate
trans: n. 基质；基片；底层（等于substratum）；酶作用物

sentences.english: As chemical precursors stream onto the surface of a rolling metal or plastic substrate, they react with one another to form a network of nanoparticles.
sentences.chinese: 各化学母质流向滚动中的金属或塑料基片的表面，他们互相作用，形成一层纳米级微粒网状结构。

sentences.english: Fundamentally, these paradigms can be (and are) built on top of a substrate of threads and locks, but they create higher level abstractions that push much of that complexity down.
sentences.chinese: 从根本上讲，这些范例可以（且是）构建于线程和锁的基底之上，但是它们创建降低复杂度的更高的抽象级别。

sentences.english: This means that a file system would serve as a reasonable substrate for a synchronization database.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着文件系统作为同步数据库的底层支持是合情合理的。

detailed_translations.english: the substance upon which an enzyme acts

name: catfish
trans: n. 鲶鱼

sentences.english: Why should we care about catfish?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么要关注鲶鱼？

sentences.english: However, many fish, such as shark, catfish, swordfish, and sea trout, contain almost one-third fat, while salmon and orange roughy contain over 50%.
sentences.chinese: 然而，许多鱼类，如鲨鱼，鲶鱼，旗鱼和海鳟，含有近三分之一脂肪，而鲑鱼和橘棘鲷（红鱼）则超过50％。

sentences.english: And plenty of other animals have a different array of receptors, Li says, from chickens that also lack the sweet gene to catfish that can detect amino acids in water at nanomolar concentrations.
sentences.chinese: 李霞说，其他动物也有各种不同的受体，比如说鸡也缺少察觉甜味的基因，只要附近水中的氨基酸浓度达到纳摩尔级别，鲶鱼就能发觉。

detailed_translations.english: a type of fish that has whiskers around its mouth and lives in rivers or lakes

name: crawdad
trans: n. 喇蛄（一种淡水小龙虾）；（美）退缩者（等于crawfish）

name: enchanted
trans: adj. 被施魔法的 v. 使着魔（enchant的过去式）

name: fiberglass
trans: n. 玻璃纤维；玻璃丝

sentences.english: The body is fiberglass and carbon fiber.
sentences.chinese: 车身材料为玻璃纤维和碳纤维。

sentences.english: This generally takes two or three days for plaster casts, and an hour for fiberglass casts.
sentences.chinese: 对于石膏板，大约要两三天，而玻璃纤维夹板则仅仅只用一个小时。

sentences.english: If the centerboard is not weighted, like the fiberglass centerboards of many small sailboats, then sailors must keep the boat upright by positioning their own weight on the upwind side of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 如果活动龙骨不带负重，例如许多小型帆船使用的玻璃纤维活动龙骨，那么水手们必须通过将他们自己的体重压在船只的逆风侧来保持船只直立。

name: fishing
trans: n. 渔业；捕鱼（术）；试探；装配 adj. 钓鱼的；钓鱼用的 v. 捕鱼（fish的ing形式）

sentences.english: Fishing is one of his hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 钓鱼是他的一项业余爱好。

sentences.english: Terry’s going fishing at Lake Arrowhead next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 特里下周末要到阿罗黑德湖钓鱼。

detailed_translations.english: the sport or business of catching fish

name: intolerable
trans: adj. 无法忍受的；难耐的

sentences.english: ‘This is intolerable!’ exclaimed Sir Rufus.
sentences.chinese: “这真令人难以忍受！”鲁弗斯爵士喊道。

sentences.english: The pain had become intolerable.
sentences.chinese: 痛得不能忍受。

detailed_translations.english: too difficult, bad, annoying etc for you to accept or deal with

name: contract
trans: n. 合同，契约；婚约；（非正式）暗杀协议；（桥牌）定约 v. 收缩，缩短；感染；订约；订（婚）；负（债）；结交

sentences.english: Employees who refuse to relocate are in breach of contract (= have done something not allowed by their contracts ) .
sentences.chinese: 员工拒绝调动岗位是违反合约的。

detailed_translations.english: an official agreement between two or more people, stating what each will do

name: electricity
trans: n. 电力；电流；强烈的紧张情绪

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: engineer
trans: n. 工程师；工兵；火车司机 vt. 设计；策划；精明地处理 vi. 设计；建造

sentences.english: He trained as a civil engineer (= one who designs and builds roads, bridges etc ).
sentences.chinese: 他接受过土木工程师培训。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design or build roads, bridges, machines etc

name: invent
trans: vt. 发明；创造；虚构

sentences.english: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大 · 格雷厄姆 · 贝尔于1876年发明了电话。

detailed_translations.english: to make, design, or think of a new type of thing

name: technology
trans: n. 技术；工艺；术语

sentences.english: Modern technology makes moving money around much easier than it used to be.
sentences.chinese: 现代科技使货币流动比以前便捷得多。

sentences.english: Advances in technology have improved crop yields by over 30%.
sentences.chinese: 科技的进步使庄稼产量提高了30%以上。

sentences.english: There have been major new developments in satellite technology.
sentences.chinese: 卫星技术有了重大的新发展。

sentences.english: Many people are unwilling to embrace new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 很多人不愿意接受新科技。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
detailed_translations.english: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

name: agriculture
trans: n. 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学

sentences.english: More than 75% of the land is used for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 75%以上的土地用于农耕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 农业；农耕；农业生产；农艺，农学
detailed_translations.english: the practice or science of farming

name: fertilizer
trans: n. [肥料] 肥料；受精媒介物；促进发展者

sentences.english: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.
sentences.chinese: …不使用任何购买的化学品、肥料或杀虫剂的耕作。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

name: professor
trans: n. 教授；教师；公开表示信仰的人

sentences.english: The professor improvised a poem in the class.
sentences.chinese: 教授在课堂上即兴创作了一首诗。

sentences.english: The professor lambasted me for my careless mistake.
sentences.chinese: 教授严厉批评了我的粗心错误。

sentences.english: We were laughing about that absent-minded professor.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在笑那个心不在焉的教授。

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋 vi. 向...提供资金

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: abandoned
trans: adj. 被抛弃的；（房屋，车辆）被废弃的；无约束的，恣意放荡的 v. 抛弃；离弃；放弃（abandon 的过去式和过去分词）

name: deserted
trans: adj. 荒芜的；被遗弃的；无人居住的 v. 遗弃；放弃；抛弃；开小差（desert 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: At the edge of the desert, he came across a deserted church.
sentences.chinese: 在沙漠的边缘地带，他碰巧发现了一个被遗弃的教堂。

sentences.english: Poor farmers are deserting their parched farm fields and coming here looking for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷的农民丢下干旱的农田，来这里寻找工作。

detailed_translations.english: a wife etc who has been left by her husband etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗弃（desert的过去式和过去分词）
detailed_translations.english: If people or animals desert a place, they leave it and it becomes empty

name: radiation
trans: n. 辐射；放射物

sentences.english: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.english: a lethal dose of radiation
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的辐射

sentences.english: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

detailed_translations.english: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

name: bacteria
trans: n. [微] 细菌

sentences.english: Some of these bacteria are actually good for you.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

detailed_translations.english: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

name: bioluminescent
trans: adj. 生物性发光的

name: camouflage
trans: n. 伪装，掩饰 vt. 伪装，掩饰 vi. 伪装起来

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: molecule
trans: n. [化学] 分子；微小颗粒，微粒

sentences.english: The molecules of oxygen gas contain just two atoms.
sentences.chinese: 氧分子中只有两个原子。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest unit into which any substance can be divided without losing its own chemical nature, usually consisting of two or more atoms

name: prey
trans: n. 猎物；受害者，牺牲品；（情绪易受伤的）脆弱的人；掠夺品 v. 捕食；伤害；折磨，困扰 n. (Prey) （美、德、爱）普赖（人名）

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: festivity
trans: n. 欢庆，欢宴；庆典；欢乐

sentences.english: The festivities started with a procession through the town.
sentences.chinese: 庆祝活动以全城巡游开场。

detailed_translations.english: things such as drinking, eating, or dancing that are done to celebrate a special occasion

name: interception
trans: n. 拦截，截住；截断，截取；侦听，窃听

name: merge
trans: vt. 合并；使合并；吞没 vi. 合并；融合 n. (Merge)人名；(意)梅尔杰

sentences.english: The company plans to merge its subsidiaries in the US.
sentences.chinese: 该公司计划合并其在美国的几家子公司。

detailed_translations.english: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

name: root
trans: n. 根；根源；词根；祖先 vi. 生根；根除 vt. 生根，固定；根源在于 n. (Root)人名；(英)鲁特；(德、瑞典)罗特

sentences.english: tree roots
sentences.chinese: 树根

sentences.english: These plants produce a number of thin roots.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物会长出一些细根。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a plant or tree that grows under the ground and gets water from the soil
to grow roots

name: trounce
trans: vt. 痛打；严责；打败

sentences.english: We were trounced 13-0.
sentences.chinese: 我们以0比13惨败。

detailed_translations.english: to defeat someone completely

name: underdog
trans: n. 比赛中不被看好者；失败者；受压迫者；斗败了的狗

sentences.english: Crowds often feel sympathy for the underdog.
sentences.chinese: 观众经常会同情弱者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛中不被看好者；失败者；受压迫者；斗败了的狗

name: dismount
trans: v. 下（马、车等）；将（某物）从支架上移开（或卸下）；取出（磁盘） n. （体操动作的）下法，完成

name: gallop
trans: n. 疾驰；飞奔 vi. 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说 vt. 使飞跑；迅速运输 n. (Gallop)人名；(英)盖洛普

sentences.english: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫尝试一次骑马疾驰。

detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

name: posture
trans: n. 姿势；态度；情形 vi. 摆姿势 vt. 作…的姿势

sentences.english: her upright posture
sentences.chinese: 她笔挺的姿势

detailed_translations.english: the way you position your body when sitting or standing

name: trot
trans: n. （人）慢跑；马小跑的步态；小跑的马蹄声；刚学步的小孩；老太婆；腹泻；（学生作弊用的）译文对照本 vi. （马）小跑；（人）慢跑；快步走 vt. 使小跑；使快步走

sentences.english: Alan took the reins and the small horse started trotting.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦抓住缰绳，小马开始慢跑起来。

sentences.english: Our horses slowed to a trot.
sentences.chinese: 我们的马减速慢跑。

sentences.english: She broke into a trot (= started running slowly ) and hurried on ahead of us.
sentences.chinese: 她突然小跑起来，赶到我们前头。

detailed_translations.english: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
the movement of a horse at trotting speed

name: frustrated
trans: adj. 懊恼的，沮丧的；无效的，没有得到满足的；失意的，不得志的；（性欲）被抑制的 v. 挫败；阻挠（frustrate 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: He gets frustrated when people don’t understand what he’s trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 人们不懂他在说什么时，他就会很懊丧。

sentences.english: The government has deliberately frustrated his efforts to gain work permits for his foreign staff.
sentences.chinese: 政府蓄意挫败了他为其外国员工取得工作许可证的努力。

detailed_translations.english: someone who wants to develop a particular skill but has not been able to do this

detailed_translations.chinese: 挫败；阻挠（frustrate的过去式和过去分词形式）
detailed_translations.english: If someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding

name: gemstone
trans: n. （经雕琢的）宝石

sentences.english: Blue turquoise is valued as a gemstone.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色的绿松石被视为宝石。

sentences.english: Ruby, the common name for the mineral corundum in its red form, is a precious gemstone.
sentences.chinese: 红宝石是对红色矿物刚玉的俗称，它是一种珍贵的宝石。

sentences.english: In particular, we carefully selected for you 12 beautiful gemstone pendants in the hope it can help you resist following illness.
sentences.chinese: 我们特别为您精心挑选了12种漂亮的宝石垂饰，希望它能助您抵抗以下病痛。

detailed_translations.english: A gemstone is a jewel or stone used in jewellery

name: remarkable
trans: adj. 卓越的；非凡的；值得注意的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: stepmother
trans: n. 继母，后母

sentences.english: She looked at me as if I were the wicked stepmother.
sentences.chinese: 她看我的眼神，我简直就是一个恶毒的后母。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is married to your father but who is not your mother

name: treasure
trans: n. 财富，财产；财宝；珍品 vt. 珍爱；珍藏 n. (Treasure)（英、美、爱）特雷热（人名）

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery
to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you

name: wicked
trans: adj. 邪恶的；恶劣的；不道德的；顽皮的

sentences.english: the wicked stepmother in ‘Hansel and Gretel’
sentences.chinese: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

name: cartilage
trans: n. 软骨

sentences.english: Andre Agassi has pulled out of next week's Grand Slam Cup after tearing a cartilage in his chest.
sentences.chinese: 安德烈·阿加西胸部软骨拉伤后已退出了下周的大满贯赛事。

detailed_translations.english: a strong substance that can bend, which is around the joints in your body and in your outer ear

name: ligament
trans: n. 韧带；纽带，系带

sentences.english: He tore a ligament in his left knee.
sentences.chinese: 他拉伤了左膝韧带。

sentences.english: damaged ankle ligaments
sentences.chinese: 受伤的踝关节韧带

detailed_translations.english: a band of strong material in your body, similar to muscle, that joins bones or holds an organ in its place

name: tendon
trans: n. [解剖] 腱 n. (Tendon)人名；(法)唐东

sentences.english: ...a torn tendon in his right shoulder.
sentences.chinese: …他右肩一根被拉伤的腱。

detailed_translations.english: a thick strong string-like part of your body that connects a muscle to a bone

name: vertebrate
trans: n. 脊椎动物 adj. 脊椎动物（有关）的；有脊椎的

sentences.english: Because these cells are among the largest in the vertebrate brain, they were the first neurons to be identified.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些细胞是脊椎动物大脑中最大的细胞，它们是最早被识别出来的神经元。

sentences.english: Zoonoses are defined by the WHO as “Any disease or infection which is naturally transmissible from vertebrate animals to man".
sentences.chinese: 世界卫生组织将人畜共患病定义为“任何自然地从脊椎动物传播到人类的疾病或传染病”。

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that has a backbone

name: budget
trans: n. 预算，预算费 vt. 安排，预定；把…编入预算 vi. 编预算，做预算 adj. 廉价的

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

name: footpath
trans: n. 人行道；小路；小径

sentences.english: He said he had just picked up the druken man from the footpath and did not know him from Adam.
sentences.chinese: 他说他只是把这个倒在人行道上的醉汉扶了起来，他根本不认识他。

sentences.english: The sun was shining gloriously, so Karen and the old lady went along the footpath through the corn, where it was rather dusty.
sentences.chinese: 那天艳阳高照，凯伦和老妇人沿着穿过玉米地的小路去教堂，一路上灰尘漫天。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow path for people to walk along, especially in the country

name: summit
trans: n. 顶点；最高级会议；最高阶层 adj. 最高级的；政府首脑的

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: terrain
trans: n. [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带

sentences.english: rocky terrain
sentences.chinese: 多石的地形

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of land

name: transform
trans: vt. 改变，使…变形；转换 vi. 变换，改变；转化

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: lawyer
trans: n. 律师；法学家 n. (Lawyer)人名；(英)劳耶

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: nomination
trans: n. 任命，提名；提名权

sentences.english: All the committee’s nominations were approved.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会的所有提名均获得批准。

detailed_translations.english: the act of officially suggesting someone or something for a position, duty or prize, or the fact of being suggested for it

name: senator
trans: n. 参议员；（古罗马的）元老院议员；评议员，理事 n. (Senator)人名；(瑞典、斯威)塞纳托尔

sentences.english: Senator Kennedy
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪参议员

detailed_translations.english: a member of the Senate or a senate

name: Celtic
trans: adj. 凯尔特人的；凯尔特语的 n. 凯尔特语（等于Keltic）

name: prediction
trans: n. 预报；预言

sentences.english: The data can be used to make useful economic predictions .
sentences.chinese: 这些数据可用于进行有用的经济预测。

detailed_translations.english: a statement about what you think is going to happen, or the act of making this statement

name: supernatural

sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.chinese: 他的伟大成就在于把所有选手组织成一支团结的队伍。

sentences.chinese: 她想当芭蕾舞演员。

sentences.chinese: 我的舞蹈编导总是不断雕琢我，一心将我塑造成完美的舞蹈家。

sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

name: embarrassment
trans: n. 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据

sentences.english: He could not hide his embarrassment at his children’s rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他无法掩饰自己孩子的无礼给他带来的难堪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 窘迫，难堪；使人为难的人或事物；拮据
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you are embarrassed

name: jealousy
trans: n. 嫉妒；猜忌；戒备

sentences.english: Sexual jealousy is a common motive for murder.
sentences.chinese: 性嫉妒是常见的谋杀动机。

sentences.english: feelings of professional jealousy
sentences.chinese: 职业上的嫉妒感

sentences.english: He quickly discovered the petty jealousies and gossip of village life.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就发现，在乡村生活中，人们狭隘善妒，喜欢传播流言蜚语。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being jealous

name: putrid
trans: adj. 腐败的；腐烂的；令人厌恶的

sentences.english: the putrid smells from the slaughterhouses
sentences.chinese: 屠宰场散发出的腐臭味

detailed_translations.chinese: 腐败的；腐烂的；令人厌恶的
detailed_translations.english: dead animals, plants etc that are putrid are decaying and smell very bad

name: sneer
trans: vi. 嘲笑，冷笑 vt. 嘲笑，冷笑 n. 嘲笑，冷笑

sentences.english: ‘Is that your best outfit?’ he sneered.
sentences.chinese: “那就是你最好的衣服了？”他讥笑道。

sentences.english: ‘You probably wouldn’t understand,’ he said with a sneer.
sentences.chinese: “你可能明白不了。”他冷笑了一声说道。

detailed_translations.english: to smile or speak in a very unkind way that shows you have no respect for someone or something
an unkind smile or remark that shows you have no respect for something or someone

name: snicker
trans: v. 偷笑，窃笑；（马）嘶鸣 n. 窃笑，吃吃地笑；马嘶声 n. (Snicker) （美、芬）斯尼克（人名）

sentences.english: We all snickered at Mrs. Swenson.
sentences.chinese: 我们都暗暗嘲笑斯温森太太。

sentences.english: ...a chorus of jeers and snickers.
sentences.chinese: ...一阵嗤笑。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh quietly and in a way that is not nice at something which is not supposed to be funny
Snicker is also a noun

name: consequence
trans: n. 结果；重要性；推论

sentences.english: Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to go to jail.
sentences.chinese: 她的律师说她明白自己行为的后果并准备去坐牢。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

name: determination
trans: n. 决心；果断；测定

sentences.english: his dogged determination (= very strong determination ) to succeed
sentences.chinese: 他想要成功的坚定决心

detailed_translations.english: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

name: rally
trans: v. 召集；（军队）重新集合；复原；价格回升；集结；联合；（使）重新振作；参加汽车拉力赛；对……善意打趣；嘲笑 n. 公众集会；汽车拉力赛；往返拍击；止跌回升；竞赛 n. (Rally) （美）拉利（人名）

sentences.english: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

detailed_translations.chinese: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
detailed_translations.english: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

name: reputation
trans: n. 名声，名誉；声望

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: valuable
trans: adj. 有价值的；贵重的；可估价的 n. 贵重物品

name: advertisement
trans: n. 广告，宣传

sentences.english: They put an advertisement in ‘The Morning News’, offering a high salary for the right person.
sentences.chinese: 他们在《晨报》上刊登了一则启事，出高薪寻找合适的人选。

sentences.english: The organizers of the concert had taken out a full page advertisement in ‘The New York Times’.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。

sentences.english: Only a handful of people answered the advertisement .
sentences.chinese: 只有寥寥数人对该广告作出了回应。

detailed_translations.english: a picture, set of words, or a short film, which is intended to persuade people to buy a product or use a service, or that gives information about a job that is available, an event that is going to happen etc

name: dejected
trans: adj. 沮丧的，灰心的

sentences.english: The unemployed stood at street corners, dejected.
sentences.chinese: 失业者沮丧地站在街角。

detailed_translations.english: unhappy, disappointed, or sad

name: estimate
trans: n. 估计，估价；判断，看法 v. 估计，估量；判断，评价

sentences.english: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.
sentences.chinese: 估计一下需要多少步才能到达一个近距目标。

detailed_translations.english: to try to judge the value, size, speed, cost etc of something, without calculating it exactly

detailed_translations.chinese: 估计； 评价； 看法
detailed_translations.english: a calculation of the value, size, amount etc of something made using the information that you have, which may not be complete

name: mint
trans: n. 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款 vt. 铸造，铸币 adj. 完美的 n. (Mint)人名；(毛里塔)明特

sentences.english: new potatoes sprinkled with chopped mint
sentences.chinese: 撒上薄荷屑的嫩马铃薯

sentences.english: roast lamb with mint sauce
sentences.chinese: 配薄荷调味汁的烤羔羊肉

sentences.english: Decorate with a sprig of mint .
sentences.chinese: 用小薄荷枝装饰。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄荷；[金融] 造币厂，巨款
detailed_translations.english: a small plant with green leaves that have a fresh smell and taste and are used in cooking
to make a coin
looking new and in perfect condition

name: numismatist
trans: n. 钱币奖章收藏家

sentences.english: His grandfather is a numismatist.
sentences.chinese: 他爷爷是个钱币收藏家。

detailed_translations.chinese: 钱币学家， 钱币收藏家
detailed_translations.english: someone who collects and studies coins and medals

name: penchant
trans: n. 嗜好；倾向

sentences.english: a penchant for fast cars
sentences.chinese: 对跑车的酷爱

detailed_translations.english: if you have a penchant for something, you like that thing very much and try to do it or have it often

name: anticipation
trans: n. 预料，预期；预感；预知；盼望，希望；先发制人

sentences.english: She waited in eager anticipation for Robert to arrive.
sentences.chinese: 她急切地期盼着罗伯特到来。

sentences.english: Taylor was excited and full of anticipation at the prospect of the trip.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒很兴奋，对这次旅行满怀期待。

detailed_translations.english: when you are expecting something to happen

name: arrogance
trans: n. 自大；傲慢态度

sentences.english: I couldn’t believe the arrogance of the man!
sentences.chinese: 我真不敢相信那个男人那么傲慢！

detailed_translations.english: when someone behaves in a rude way because they think they are very important

name: chafed
trans: v. 摩擦；激怒（chafe的过去式）

name: challenge
trans: n. 挑战；怀疑 vt. 向…挑战；对…质疑

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: squirm
trans: vi. 蠕动，扭动；羞愧，不舒服 n. 蠕动

sentences.english: Christine squirmed uncomfortably in her chair.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯蒂娜坐在椅子上不自在地扭来扭去。

sentences.english: The boy tried to squirm free.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩想要挣脱开。

detailed_translations.english: to twist your body from side to side because you are uncomfortable or nervous, or to get free from something which is holding you

name: brochure
trans: n. 手册，小册子 n. (Brochure) （美）布罗许尔（人名）

sentences.english: a holiday brochure
sentences.chinese: 度假手册

detailed_translations.english: a thin book giving information or advertising something

name: bustling
trans: adj. 熙熙攘攘的；忙乱的

name: calculation
trans: n. 计算；估计；计算的结果；深思熟虑

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

name: integrity
trans: n. 完整；正直；诚实；廉正

sentences.english: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 我一直把他当作一个正直诚实的人。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being honest and strong about what you believe to be right

name: inventory
trans: n. 存货，存货清单；详细目录；财产清册

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

name: suspended
trans: adj. 悬浮的；暂停的，缓期的（宣判）

name: concerto
trans: n. 协奏曲

sentences.english: ...Tchaikovsky's First Piano Concerto.
sentences.chinese: …柴可夫斯基的《第一钢琴协奏曲》。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of  classical  music, usually for one instrument and an  orchestra

name: organ
trans: n. 器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音；阴茎 n. （Organ）人名；（英）奥根

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: organist
trans: n. 风琴演奏者

name: prodigy
trans: n. 奇迹，奇事；奇才；奇观；预兆

sentences.english: The Russian tennis prodigy is well on the way to becoming the youngest world champion of all time.
sentences.chinese: 这位俄罗斯网球奇才已很有望成为历史上最年轻的世界冠军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奇迹，奇事；奇才；奇观；预兆
detailed_translations.english: A prodigy is someone young who has a great natural ability for something such as music, mathematics, or sports

name: requiem
trans: n. 安魂曲；追思弥撒

sentences.chinese: ...一场威尔第的《安魂曲》的演奏。

detailed_translations.english: a Christian ceremony in which prayers are said for someone who has died

name: scale
trans: n. 规模；比例；鳞；刻度；天平；数值范围 vi. 衡量；攀登；剥落；生水垢 vt. 测量；攀登；刮鳞；依比例决定 n. (Scale)人名；(意)斯卡莱

sentences.english: A structural survey revealed the full scale of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 结构检验揭示了实际受损程度。

sentences.english: I was shocked by the sheer scale (= very big scale ) of the destruction.
sentences.chinese: 破坏程度之大让我大为震惊。

sentences.english: Large firms benefit from economies of scale (= ways of saving money because they are big ) .
sentences.chinese: 大公司从规模经济中得益。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大小，规模；等级，级别；天平，磅秤；比例；刻度，标度；鳞

to climb to the top of something that is high and difficult to climb

sentences.english: Carrying goods by train costs nearly three times more than carrying them by barge.
sentences.chinese: 通过铁路运货的成本比驳船运货成本高出近3倍。

detailed_translations.english: a large low boat with a flat bottom, used for carrying goods on a canal or river

trans: vt. 召唤；吸引 vi. 吸引；（招手或点头）示意 n. 表召唤的点头；手势

sentences.chinese: 我看到我丈夫在向我招手。

detailed_translations.english: to make a signal to someone with your hand, to show that you want them to come towards you or to follow you

trans: n. 枯竭；耗尽；精疲力竭

sentences.chinese: 我们可以把burnout (燃尽)解释为 exhaustion (耗尽)。

sentences.english: Could not this very Socratic way be  a sign of collapse, exhaustion, sickness, and the dissolution of the  anarchic instinct?
sentences.chinese: 这个非常苏格拉底式的方法不能是无法无天的天性的崩塌、耗尽、疾患和解体的一个信号？

detailed_translations.english: when all of something has been used

sentences.english: Sylvia fetched a towel from the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅从浴室拿来一条毛巾。

sentences.english: Fetch me a glass of water.
sentences.chinese: 给我拿杯水来。

detailed_translations.english: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are

name: tingle

sentences.english: My body tingled all over and I had a terrible headache.
sentences.chinese: 我全身刺痛，头疼欲裂。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of your body tingles, you feel a slight stinging feeling, especially on your skin

name: trustworthy
trans: adj. 可靠的；可信赖的

sentences.english: He is a trustworthy and level-headed leader.
sentences.chinese: 他是个可信赖的、头脑冷静的领导。

detailed_translations.english: able to be trusted and depended on

name: decay
trans: v. 衰退，衰减；衰败；腐烂，腐朽 n. 衰退，衰减；衰败；腐烂，腐朽 n. (Decay) （法、美、意、英、希）德凯（人名）

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: fungi
trans: n. 真菌；菌类；蘑菇（fungus的复数） n. (Fungi)人名；(意)丰吉

sentences.english: Without the fungi, this would be just another sandbar.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有真菌，这里将成为另一个沙洲。

sentences.english: But without fungi we would not have gardens, houses or even feet at all.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果没有真菌，我们就不会有花园、住宅，甚至脚。

sentences.english: Some of those carbon products transfer from the roots to symbiotic fungi and soil microbes, which store the carbon in the soil as humus.
sentences.chinese: 这些含碳化合物有部分从根部被共生真菌和土壤中的微生物摄取，最后变成腐殖质储存在土壤里。

name: microbe
trans: n. 细菌，微生物

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: organism
trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: cycle
trans: n. 循环；周期；自行车；整套；一段时间 vt. 使循环；使轮转 vi. 循环；骑自行车；轮转

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: resolution
trans: n. [物] 分辨率；决议；解决；决心

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: symbolize
trans: vt. 象征；用符号表现 vi. 采用象征；使用符号；作为…的象征

sentences.english: Crime often symbolizes a wider social problem.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪问题往往反映出更广泛的社会问题。

sentences.english: Growing discontent has been symbolized by the protests.
sentences.chinese: 与日俱增的不满通过一次又一次的抗议表现出来。

detailed_translations.english: if something symbolizes a quality, feeling etc, it represents it

name: usher
trans: n. 引座员，带位员；接待员；门房 vt. 引导，招待；迎接；开辟 vi. 作招待员；当引座员 n. (Usher)人名；(英)厄舍；(西、科特)乌谢尔

sentences.english: He did part-time work as an usher in a theatre.
sentences.chinese: 他曾在一家剧院做兼职引座员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 引座员，带位员；接待员；门房
detailed_translations.english: someone who shows people to their seats at a theatre, cinema, wedding etc

name: blizzard
trans: n. 暴风雪，大风雪；大打击 vi. 下暴风雪 n. (Blizzard)人名；(英)布利泽德

sentences.english: We got stuck in a blizzard.
sentences.chinese: 我们被暴风雪困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a severe snowstorm

name: enormous
trans: adj. 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: sleet
