sentences.english: Photo Tip: When shooting in cold weather, or extreme conditions such as snow and sleet, it's important not to change your lenses outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 拍照小技巧：在寒冷的天气里，或者遇到极端天气的时候，如下雪或者雨夹雪，想要拍照，最重要的是注意不要在户外更换镜头。

sentences.english: The three boys threw their hockey gear to the top of the hill and tried crawling up the path, but the sleet had created a smooth glacier with nothing to hold on to.
sentences.chinese: 三个男孩儿把他们的冰球装备扔到山顶上，然后试着沿小路往上爬，但雨夹雪已经令山坡变得更加的滑，而且没有任何可以抓住的东西。

detailed_translations.english: half-frozen rain that falls when it is very cold

name: visible
trans: adj. 明显的；看得见的；现有的；可得到的 n. 可见物；进出口贸易中的有形项目

sentences.english: The comet is visible to the naked eye (= can be seen without using special equipment ).
sentences.chinese: 这颗彗星肉眼看得见。

sentences.english: Check the plant for any visible signs of disease.
sentences.chinese: 检查一下植物是否有患病的迹象。

detailed_translations.english: something that is visible can be seen

name: ancient
trans: adj. 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的 n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

name: procession
trans: n. 队伍，行列；一列，一排；列队行进 vi. 列队行进 vt. 沿著……行进

sentences.english: They marched in procession to the Capitol building.
sentences.chinese: 他们列队向国会大厦行进。

detailed_translations.chinese: 队伍，行列；一列，一排；列队行进
detailed_translations.english: a line of people or vehicles moving slowly as part of a ceremony

name: racist
trans: n. 种族主义者 adj. 种族主义的

sentences.english: He denied being a racist.
sentences.chinese: 他否认自己是种族主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that people of their own race are better than others, and who treats people from other races unfairly and sometimes violently – used to show disapproval

name: sauna
trans: n. 桑拿浴 vi. 洗桑拿浴 n. (Sauna)人名；(芬)绍纳

sentences.english: The hotel has a sauna, solarium and heated indoor swimming pool.
sentences.chinese: 这家旅馆有一个桑拿浴室、日光浴室和室内温水游泳池。

detailed_translations.english: a room that is heated to a very high temperature by hot air, where people sit because it is considered healthy

name: terrorist
trans: n. 恐怖主义者，恐怖分子 adj. 恐怖主义者的，恐怖分子的

sentences.english: We refuse to talk to terrorists.
sentences.chinese: 我们拒绝和恐怖分子对话。

sentences.english: a terrorist bomb that left 168 people dead
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子引爆造成168人死亡的炸弹

detailed_translations.english: someone who uses violence such as bombing, shooting etc to obtain political demands

name: circumference
trans: n. 圆周；周长；胸围

sentences.english: ...a scientist calculating the Earth's circumference.
sentences.chinese: …一位正在计算地球周长的科学家。

detailed_translations.english: the distance or measurement around the outside of a circle or any round shape

name: diameter
trans: n. 直径

sentences.english: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
sentences.chinese: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

detailed_translations.english: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

name: digit
trans: n. 数字；手指或足趾；一指宽

sentences.english: Her telephone number differs from mine by one digit.
sentences.chinese: 她的电话号码跟我的差一个数字。

detailed_translations.chinese: 数字；手指或足趾；一指宽
detailed_translations.english: one of the written signs that represent the numbers 0 to 9

name: divide
trans: v. （使）分开，分成；分配，分担；分隔；（道路）分叉；使产生分歧；（数）除，除以 n. 分歧，差异；分水岭；界限

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: pi
trans: abbr. 产品改进（Product Improve）

name: cold-blooded
trans: adj. [生理] 冷血的；残酷的，无情的；怕冷的

sentences.english: a cold-blooded killer
sentences.chinese: 冷血杀手

detailed_translations.english: not showing or involving any emotions or pity for other people’s suffering

name: fangs
trans: n. [脊椎] 尖牙；[脊椎] 毒牙（fang的复数）；物体的尖端 v. 用尖牙咬；配以尖牙般的东西（fang的三单形式）

name: hibernate
trans: vi. 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒

sentences.english: Dormice hibernate from October to May.
sentences.chinese: 睡鼠从10月到5月冬眠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒
detailed_translations.english: if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter

name: rattle
trans: vt. 使发出咯咯声；喋喋不休；使慌乱，使惊慌 vi. 喋喋不休地讲话；发出卡嗒卡嗒声 n. 喋喋不休的人；吓吱声，格格声 n. (Rattle)人名；(英)拉特尔

sentences.english: His mocking smile rattled her more than his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那种嘲讽的微笑比他的愤怒更让她慌乱。

sentences.english: It was hard not to get rattled when the work piled up.
sentences.chinese: 工作积了一大堆，哪能不着急呢。

sentences.english: His confidence was rattled by the accident.
sentences.chinese: 这场事故动摇了他的自信。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使发出咯咯声；喋喋不休；使慌乱，使惊慌
detailed_translations.english: to make someone lose confidence or become nervous

detailed_translations.chinese: 喋喋不休的人；吓吱声，格格声
detailed_translations.english: a short repeated sound, made when something shakes

name: venom
trans: n. 毒液；恶意 vt. 使有毒；放毒

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

name: funding
trans: n. 提供资金；用发行长期债券的方法来收回短期债券 v. 提供资金；积存（fund的ing形式）

sentences.english: They hope for government funding for the programme.
sentences.chinese: 他们希望得到政府为这一计划提供的资金。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基金， 资金； 提供资金
detailed_translations.english: Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose

name: petition
trans: n. 请愿；请愿书；祈求；[法] 诉状 vi. 请愿；请求 vt. 请愿；请求；恳求

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: signature
trans: n. 署名；签名；信号

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: competition
trans: n. 竞争；比赛，竞赛

sentences.english: Going to trade fairs is an ideal opportunity to size up the competition .
sentences.chinese: 参加商品交易会是估量竞争规模的理想机会。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people or organizations try to be more successful than other people or organizations

name: dough
trans: n. 生面团；金钱

sentences.english: Add some raisins to the dough.
sentences.chinese: 在生面团中加一些葡萄干。

sentences.english: A baker is kneading a dough.
sentences.chinese: 一位面包师正在揉面团。

sentences.english: She patted the dough into a flat cake.
sentences.chinese: 她把面团轻轻拍成扁饼。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of flour and water ready to be baked into bread,  pastry  etc

name: eliminate
trans: vt. 消除；排除

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: round
trans: adj. 圆的；弧形的；整数的；完全的；大概的；肥胖的；（声音）圆润的；（古，钱）大量的；（古，人或其说话方式）耿直的 adv. 旋转；周围；围绕；到处；迂回地；朝反方向；挨个；到某处 prep. 围绕；绕过；大约；在……周围；在……各处 n. 阶段；轮次；回合；常规活动；圆，圆形物；循环；固定路线 v. （使）变圆；完成；四舍五入；围捕；绕行；进展；环行；发胖 n. (Round) （美、英、加、澳、印、德）朗德（人名）

sentences.english: We sat round the table playing cards.
sentences.chinese: 我们围桌而坐玩纸牌。

sentences.english: Gather round! I have an important announcement to make.
sentences.chinese: 大家围拢来！我有重要事情要宣布。

sentences.english: He put his arm gently round her waist.
sentences.chinese: 他轻轻地搂着她的腰。

sentences.english: I kept the key on a chain round my neck.
sentences.chinese: 我给钥匙穿了根链子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: The ballroom’s huge, with windows all the way round .
sentences.chinese: 舞厅很大，四周都是窗户。

sentences.english: There was a lovely courtyard with tables all round .
sentences.chinese: 有一个漂亮的庭院，四周都是桌子。

detailed_translations.english: surrounding or on all sides of something or someone
shaped like a circle
a round of events is a series of related events, which are part of a longer process
on the other side of something, or to the other side of it without going through it or over it

name: station
trans: n. 车站；驻地；地位；身份 vt. 配置；安置；驻扎

sentences.english: I want to get off at the next station.
sentences.chinese: 我要在下一站下车。

sentences.english: Grand Central Station
sentences.chinese: 中央火车站

sentences.english: Is there a waiting room in the station?
sentences.chinese: 车站里有候车室吗？

sentences.english: the city bus station
sentences.chinese: 市内公共汽车站

detailed_translations.english: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty

name: ceremony
trans: n. 典礼，仪式；礼节，礼仪；客套，虚礼

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: memorial
trans: n. 纪念碑，纪念馆；纪念仪式；纪念物 adj. 记忆的；纪念的，追悼的

sentences.english: A memorial service is being held for her at St. Paul's Church.
sentences.chinese: 一场为她举行的纪念仪式正在圣保罗教堂举行。

sentences.english: The hospital was built as a memorial to King Edward VII.
sentences.chinese: 该医院是为了纪念国王爱德华七世而建的。

detailed_translations.english: done or made in order to remind people of someone who has died
something, especially a stone with writing on it, that reminds people of someone who has died

name: remembrance
trans: n. 回想，回忆；纪念品；记忆力

sentences.english: a Holocaust remembrance
sentences.chinese: 大屠杀纪念

detailed_translations.chinese: 回想，回忆；纪念品；记忆力
detailed_translations.english: a memory that you have of a person or event

name: sculpture
trans: n. 雕塑；雕刻；刻蚀 vt. 雕塑；雕刻；刻蚀 vi. 从事雕刻

sentences.english: a sculpture of an elephant
sentences.chinese: 一尊大象雕塑

sentences.english: the techniques of sculpture in stone
sentences.chinese: 石雕技艺

detailed_translations.english: an object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

name: survivor
trans: n. 幸存者；生还者；残存物

sentences.english: Don’t worry about Kurt; he’s a survivor.
sentences.chinese: 不用担心库尔特，他是个坚强的人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who continues to live after an accident, war, or illness

name: tragic
trans: adj. 悲剧的；悲痛的，不幸的

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: hieroglyph
trans: n. 象形文字；图画文字；秘密符号

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。

sentences.english: In the Late Period, the hieroglyph of the bird was used to represent this deity directly.
sentences.chinese: 在后来的时期内，鸟的象形文字直接用来表现神。

sentences.english: Initially the patterns I used were hieroglyph like symbols. After a holiday in the Maldives the "face" patterns developed. The local fishes gave me endless inspiration.
sentences.chinese: 我所采用的图案是类似符号的象形文字。在马尔代夫度假后，这些“脸”的图形开始发展。那里的鱼类给了我无穷无尽的灵感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 象形文字, 图画文字
detailed_translations.english: a picture or symbol used to represent a word or part of a word, especially in the ancient Egyptian writing system

name: pictographic
trans: adj. 象形文字的，绘画文字的

name: sacred
trans: adj. 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: scribe
trans: n. 抄写员；作家；划线器 vt. 写下，记下；用划线器划 vi. 写下，记下；担任抄写员 n. (Scribe)人名；(法)斯克里布

sentences.english: Might I your scribe and your confessor be.
sentences.chinese: 我可以你和你的忏悔神父是抄写员。

sentences.english: I stepped out of his office and was brought to a small window near the exit, behind which sat a scribe who I knew must be a prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 我走出他的办公室，被带到监狱出口处的一个小窗户边。窗后坐着一个抄写员，我知道他肯定是个囚徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone in the past whose job was to make written copies of official documents

name: hunker
trans: vi. 蹲下，盘坐 n. 守旧者

name: lurk
trans: vi. 潜伏；潜藏；埋伏 n. 潜伏；埋伏

sentences.english: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
sentences.chinese: 一种潜藏在阴影里的无形危险

detailed_translations.english: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong

name: petrified
trans: adj. 惊呆的；目瞪口呆的 v. 使石化；变僵硬；发呆（petrify的过去分词）

name: screech
trans: v. 尖叫；尖着声音地说；发出尖锐刺耳的声音；呼啸而过 n. 刺耳的尖叫，尖利刺耳的声音

sentences.english: ‘Look out!’ she screeched.
sentences.chinese: “当心！”她尖声叫道。

sentences.english: They screeched with laughter .
sentences.chinese: 他们尖声大笑。

sentences.english: The figure gave a screech.
sentences.chinese: 那个人影发出了一声尖叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出尖锐的声音；发出恐惧或痛苦的叫喊声
detailed_translations.english: to shout loudly in an unpleasant high voice because you are angry, afraid, or excited

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫声，尖利刺耳的声音；尖声喊叫
detailed_translations.english: Screech is also a noun

name: slumber
trans: n. 睡眠；麻木状态；静止状态 vi. 睡眠；蛰伏；麻木 vt. 睡眠；睡着度过

sentences.english: He passed into a deep slumber.
sentences.chinese: 他酣然入梦。

detailed_translations.english: sleep
to sleep

name: terror
trans: n. 恐怖；恐怖行动；恐怖时期；可怕的人 n. (Terror)人名；(南非)特罗尔

sentences.english: There was a look of sheer terror (= complete terror ) on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上的表情异常惊恐。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of extreme fear

name: carapace
trans: n. 壳；甲壳

name: carnivorous
trans: adj. 食肉的；肉食性的

sentences.english: Snakes are carnivorous.
sentences.chinese: 蛇都是食肉动物。

detailed_translations.english: Carnivorous animals eat meat

name: herbivorous
trans: adj. [动] 食草的

sentences.english: " Cornett's attorney, Jack Johnston, said the tooth "looks like it would be from a herbivorous rodent of some type.
sentences.chinese: 科内特的律师杰克·约翰斯顿说，这颗牙“看起来像是某种食草的啮齿类动物的牙。”

sentences.english: 'Chewing is a property which no large herbivorous terrestrial mammal has got rid of, ' said Professor Martin Sander, from Bonn University.
sentences.chinese: “现在，没有大型陆生食草哺乳动物是不需要咀嚼的，”波恩大学的马丁·桑德教授说。

sentences.english: The camel is a herbivorous animal.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼是一种食草动物。

detailed_translations.english: Herbivorous animals only eat plants

name: plastron
trans: n. 胸饰，胸甲；胸铠

name: scute
trans: n. 盾板；鳞甲

name: course
trans: n. 科目；课程；过程；进程；道路；路线，航向；一道菜 vt. 追赶；跑过 vi. 指引航线；快跑

sentences.english: Andy’s doing a one-year journalism course.
sentences.chinese: 安迪正在修读为期一年的新闻课程。

sentences.english: During the course of our conversation, it emerged that Bob had been in prison.
sentences.chinese: 我们在谈话过程中得知鲍勃坐过牢。

sentences.english: We had fish for the main course.
sentences.chinese: 我们的主菜是鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a series of lessons in a particular subject

name: deck
trans: n. 甲板；行李仓；露天平台 vt. 装饰；装甲板；打扮 n. (Deck)人名；(英、法、德)德克

sentences.english: Eddie returned to the flight deck (= the part of an aircraft where the pilot sits ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃迪回到了驾驶舱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 甲板；公共汽车一层的车厢；纸牌
detailed_translations.english: one of the levels on a bus, plane etc
to decorate something with flowers, flags etc

name: explorer
trans: n. 探险家；勘探者；探测器；[医]探针

sentences.english: ...the travels of Columbus, Magellan, and many other explorers.
sentences.chinese: …哥伦布、麦哲伦和许多其他探险家的旅行。

sentences.english: The party leader is elected by secret ballot .
sentences.chinese: 政党领袖是通过无记名投票选举产生的。

sentences.english: Workers at the plant held a ballot and rejected strike action.
sentences.chinese: 工厂工人举行投票，否决了罢工行动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 投票；投票用纸；投票总数
detailed_translations.english: a system of voting, usually in secret, or an occasion when you vote in this way
to ask someone to vote for something

name: corporation
trans: n. 公司；法人（团体）；社团；市政当局

sentences.english: He works for a large American corporation.
sentences.chinese: 他在一家美国大公司工作。

sentences.english: multinational corporations
sentences.chinese: 跨国公司

sentences.english: the Siemens Corporation
sentences.chinese: 西门子公司

detailed_translations.english: a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization

name: exceed
trans: vt. 超过；胜过 vi. 超过其他

sentences.english: Working hours must not exceed 42 hours a week.
sentences.chinese: 工作时间每周不得超过42小时。

sentences.english: His performance exceeded our expectations.
sentences.chinese: 他的表现出乎我们的预料。

sentences.english: The riot police had exceeded their authority.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察超越了他们的权限。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超过,胜过；越出 (限制、规定)
detailed_translations.english: to be more than a particular number or amount

name: finance
trans: n. 财政，财政学；金融 vt. 负担经费，供给…经费 vi. 筹措资金 n. (Finance)人名；(法)菲南斯

sentences.english: leasing and other forms of business finance
sentences.chinese: 租赁及其他商业金融形式

sentences.english: Russia’s finance minister
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯财政部长

sentences.english: the world of high finance
sentences.chinese: 高级金融界

detailed_translations.chinese: 财政，金融；财源，财务情况
detailed_translations.english: the management of money by governments, large organizations etc
to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something

name: presentation
trans: n. 展示；描述，陈述；介绍；赠送

sentences.english: the presentation ceremony
sentences.chinese: 颁奖仪式

sentences.english: Dr Evans thanked him for coming to make the presentations .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯博士感谢他来颁奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 提供， 显示； 外观， 图像； 授予， 赠送； 报告， 介绍； 表演
detailed_translations.english: the act of giving someone a prize or present at a formal ceremony

name: requirement
trans: n. 要求；必要条件；必需品

sentences.english: The refugees’ main requirements are food and shelter.
sentences.chinese: 难民的主要需求是食物和住所。

sentences.english: to meet/fulfil/satisfy the requirements
sentences.chinese: 符合 / 满足必备的条件

detailed_translations.english: something that someone needs or asks for

name: concrete
trans: adj. 混凝土的；实在的，具体的；有形的 vi. 凝结 vt. 使凝固；用混凝土修筑 n. 具体物；凝结物

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: gust
trans: n. 风味；一阵狂风；趣味 vi. 一阵阵地劲吹 n. (Gust)人名；(德、捷)古斯特

sentences.english: A gust of wind drove down the valley.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风掠过山谷。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc
if the wind gusts, it blows strongly with sudden short movements

name: hazard
trans: n. 危险，风险；冒险的事；机会；双骰子游戏；（高尔夫球的）球场障碍；（庭院网球用语）可得分区域；（台球）落入袋中 v. 大胆猜测；冒……的危险，使遭受危险；冒昧提出 n. (Hazard) 哈泽德（人名）

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.
sentences.chinese: 粗心大意的驾驶者拿他人和自己的生命冒险。

sentences.english: Polluted water sources are a hazard to wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 受污染的水源会对野生生物构成危险。

detailed_translations.english: to risk sth or put it in danger
something that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems

name: severe
trans: adj. 严峻的；严厉的；剧烈的；苛刻的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

name: shutter
trans: n. 快门；百叶窗；关闭物；遮板 vt. 为…装百叶窗；以百叶窗遮闭

sentences.english: There are a few things you should check before pressing the shutter release.
sentences.chinese: 在按快门之前，有几件事情你应该检查。

detailed_translations.chinese: 快门；百叶窗；关闭物；遮板
detailed_translations.english: one of a pair of wooden or metal covers on the outside of a window that can be closed to keep light out or prevent thieves from coming in

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…装百叶窗；以百叶窗遮闭

name: extinct
trans: adj. 灭绝的，绝种的；熄灭的 vt. 使熄灭

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: regurgitate
trans: vi. 回流；回涌；反胃；反刍 vt. 使回流；使回涌；使反刍

sentences.english: Some birds and animals regurgitate food to feed their young.
sentences.chinese: 有些鸟兽会回吐食物以喂哺幼崽。

detailed_translations.english: to bring food that you have already swallowed, back into your mouth

name: ritual
trans: n. 仪式；惯例；礼制 adj. 仪式的；例行的；礼节性的

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的，不足的；稀有的 adv. 仅仅；几乎不；几乎没有

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: shellfish
trans: n. 甲壳类动物；贝类等有壳的水生动物

sentences.english: Fish and shellfish are the specialties.
sentences.chinese: 鱼和甲壳类水生动物是特产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 甲壳类动物；贝类等有壳的水生动物
detailed_translations.english: an animal that lives in water, has a shell, and can be eaten as food, for example  crab s  ,  lobster s  , and  oyster s

name: wattle
trans: n. 板条，编条；[林] 金合欢树；枝条编成的篱笆 adj. 板条的；由编条做成的 vt. 用编条做成

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往 vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: passive
trans: adj. 被动的，消极的；被动语态的 n. 被动语态

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: snout
trans: n. 鼻子；猪嘴；烟草；鼻口部；口吻状物

sentences.english: Two alligators rest their snouts on the water's surface.
sentences.chinese: 两只鳄鱼把它们的大嘴栖息在水面上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鼻子；猪嘴；烟草；鼻口部；口吻状物
detailed_translations.english: the long nose of some kinds of animals, such as pigs

name: suction
trans: n. 吸；吸力；抽吸

sentences.english: My vacuum cleaner has very good suction.
sentences.chinese: 我的真空吸尘器吸力很强。

sentences.english: a suction pump
sentences.chinese: 抽吸泵

detailed_translations.english: the process of removing air or liquid from an enclosed space so that another substance is sucked in, or so that two surfaces stick together

name: digester
trans: n. （化）蒸煮器，煮解器；做摘要者，汇编者

name: sewage
trans: n. 污水；下水道；污物

sentences.english: Chlorine is used in sewage treatment.
sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.english: The factory secretly dumped millions of gallons of raw sewage (= sewage that had not been treated ) into the Ohio river.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of waste from the human body and used water, that is carried away from houses by pipes under the ground

name: injured
trans: adj. 受伤的；受损害的

name: orphaned
trans: 使…成孤儿（orphan的过去式）

name: rescue
trans: v. 营救，援救；（非正式）防止……丢失 n. 营救，解救，援救；营救行动

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: wildlife
trans: n. 野生动植物 adj. 野生动植物的

sentences.english: measures to protect the area’s wildlife
sentences.chinese: 保护该地区野生生物的措施

sentences.english: the destruction of wildlife habitats
sentences.chinese: 野生动植物生存环境的破坏

detailed_translations.english: animals and plants growing in natural conditions

name: burrow
trans: v. 挖地洞，挖通道；依偎；挖穿；钻入；（使）……钻到……下面；（在……里）搜寻；深入查询 n. （动物的，尤指兔子挖的）洞穴，地洞 n. (Burrow) （美）伯罗（人名）

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: environment
trans: n. 环境，外界

sentences.english: Some of these chemicals are very damaging to the environment.
sentences.chinese: 这些化学品中有些对环境非常有害。

sentences.english: legislation to protect the environment
sentences.chinese: 保护环境的法规

sentences.english: the effects of acid rain on the environment
sentences.chinese: 酸雨对环境的影响

sentences.english: the government minister for the environment
sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

detailed_translations.english: the air, water, and land on Earth, which is affected by man’s activities

name: erosion
trans: n. 侵蚀，腐蚀

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

name: canopy
trans: n. 天篷；华盖；遮篷；苍穹 vt. 用天蓬遮盖；遮盖

sentences.english: the forest canopy
sentences.chinese: 森林的树冠层

detailed_translations.english: a cover made of cloth that is fixed above a bed, seat etc as a decoration or as a shelter

name: coniferous
trans: adj. 结球果的；松柏科的

name: deciduous
trans: adj. 落叶性的，脱落性的；非永久性的

sentences.english: Deciduous antlers; deciduous leaves; deciduous teeth .
sentences.chinese: 脱落的鹿角；落叶；脱落的牙齿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非永久的； 短暂的； 脱落的； 落叶的
detailed_translations.english: deciduous trees lose their leaves in winter

name: ecosystem
trans: n. 生态系统

sentences.english: ...the forest ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: …森林生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment
